evaluators.description: Evaluators are nascent in your product and have likely provided you with minimal information, such as their email address, to learn more about your product. If you offer a free trial, they have signed up. If you do not, they have had a demo with an account executive and/or received access to a demo account.

engage.description: In somebody else's lake. You dream about going up there. But that is a big mistake. Just look at the world around you. Right here on the ocean floor
Down where it's wetter Take it from me Up on the shore they work all day. Out in the sun they slave away. While we devotin'. Full time to floatin' Under the sea

engage.header: Down here all the fish is happy
engage.description: As off through the waves they roll The fish on the land ain't happy They sad 'cause they in their bowl But fish in the bowl is lucky

beginners.description: Beginners understand how your product can solve their needs and provide value—and they’re excited about it! This excitement is driving them spend more time with your product and to explore its features and functionality more deeply. These users may not be paying customers yet, but they’re mentally prepared to make that leap now that they’ve realized the value that your product provides.

engage.description: In somebody else's lake. You dream about going up there. But that is a big mistake. Just look at the world around you. Right here on the ocean floor
Down where it's wetter Take it from me Up on the shore they work all day. Out in the sun they slave away. While we devotin'. Full time to floatin' Under the sea

engage.header: Down here all the beginners are happy

regulars.description: Regulars have mastered the core use cases for your product and are curious about the other problems your product can solve. They’re very familiar with your interface and are unlikely to need much help—however, changes to the product, both large and small, can cause friction disrupt their workflows.

engage.description: In somebody else's lake. You dream about going up there. But that is a big mistake. Just look at the world around you. Right here on the ocean floor
Down where it's wetter Take it from me Up on the shore they work all day. Out in the sun they slave away. While we devotin'. Full time to floatin' Under the sea

engage.header: Down here all the regulars are happy
engage.description: As off through the waves they roll The fish on the land ain't happy They sad 'cause they in their bowl But fish in the bowl is lucky

champions.description: Champions are heavily invested in the future of your product, and have tied themselves to your success. If you were to shut the doors tomorrow, they would be devastated (shout out to Inbox fans). These are the people who recommend your product to their colleagues, friends, and social media followers. They have formed an emotional connection with your brand and your product—at this point in the relationship, you are providing value outside of the job to be done.

engage.description: In somebody else's lake. You dream about going up there. But that is a big mistake. Just look at the world around you. Right here on the ocean floor
